result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L Hubbard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge=$543, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 2/1/16 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a  8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence on   1/18/2016 at 9:00am

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald L Hubbard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:43am [mo]
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Hubbard

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence on   1/18/2016 at 9:00am
recess: 11:19am--reconvene: 11:21am
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge=$543, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 2/1/16 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a  8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess: 11:26am
Conflict Review Worksheet - No conflict found

Case called at 9:52 am [mo]
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance
  
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Hubbard. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Atty. Luchsinger requests a PTC and STC be scheduled.
recess: 9:56am

NEXT: (1)PTC on 12/2/15 at 2:00pm (2)STC on 1/5/16 at 9:30am

Case called at 10:25am [mo]
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record.
Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Hubbard indicates that he has recently lost his job.

The Court orders Mr. Hubbard as a further condition of his bond to go to the Jefferson County Public Defender's office today (10/6/2015) and reapply for counsel, if it is determined that Mr. Hubbard is not eligible for Public Defender representation he is then to apply with the Clerk of Court's office a petition for court appointed counsel no later than 48 hours after determination of non eligibility. 

Right to Counsel given
recess:10:31am

NEXT: Status Conference on 10/27/15 at 9:30am
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

ADDRESS INFO for Reginald L Hubbard
Current: 113 N. 10th Street Apt #3, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2015)
Prior: 203 S 6th St, Watertown, WI 53094
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 11:10am. 
Defendant Reginald L Hubbard in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct.  Mr. Hubbard provides a new address.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court continues the $150 Cash Bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Katrina Thompson or with MDT (dob 12/07/02)
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
-to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 11:13am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/9/15 at 10:20am   (2)  Status Conference on 10/6/15 at 10:00am
